project.teaser: BLUE4ALL will align top-down regulatory demands about European (networks of) MPAs with bottom-up societal expectations as a guarantee for achieving effective, efficient and resilient MPAs and networks of MPAs which meet EU Biodiversity Strategy 2030 objectives. By mobilizing...
project.objective: BLUE4ALL will align top-down regulatory demands about European (networks of) MPAs with bottom-up societal expectations as a guarantee for achieving effective, efficient and resilient MPAs and networks of MPAs which meet EU Biodiversity Strategy 2030 objectives. By mobilizing stakeholders from BLUE4ALL’s 25 information sites and Living Labs, i.e. locations across the Mediterranean Sea, the Baltic Sea and the North-East Atlantic regions where (networks of) MPAs have been established and from which lessons learned can be drawn about success and failure relative to how challenges were tackled, we will co-create robust and replicable social, governance, ecological and environmental tools to meet conservation and/or restoration objectives in socially sustainable and acceptable ways. These science-based tools will be tested in Living Labs, i.e. locations where (networks of) MPAs are in the process of establishment and where these tools can be fed into the ongoing MPA process. The operationalized and tested frameworks will ultimately be generalized into a Blueprint Platform for the co-creation of effective, efficient and resilient (networks of) MPAs. This scheme will separate generically encountered challenges and applied solutions from MPA (network)-specific challenges and solutions and develop guidance in a user-friendly manner to end-users (i.e. MPA (network) managers and authorities). This guidance will take the shape of an interactive web-based Blueprint Platform directing the end-users to those challenges and solutions most applicable to their site(s). User-friendliness and applicability will be maximized by cross-checking the Blueprint Platform development with the actors and stakeholders of the Living Labs throughout the whole process of its development. Knowledge transfer and interaction with stakeholders and society-at-large at local to regional scales will lead to the development of a platform for MPA networking to interact with communities of practice boosting the BLUE4ALL legacy to its ultimate goal to restore our oceans and waters.
project.title: Blueprint demonstration for co-created effective, efficient and resilient networks of MPAs
project.keywords: MPAs, MPA networks, challenges and solutions, co-creation, effective and efficient MPAs, resilient MPAs, Living Labs, user-friendly Blueprint Platform, community of practice, MPA networking

result.title: Living lab testing package
result.description: Set of methodologies that guide and standardize the process of tool co-creation, and validation - linked with task 4.2.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - BLUE4ALL (Blueprint demonstration for co-created effective, efficient and resilient networks of MPAs)
result.teaser: The EU Biodiversity Strategy 2030 (EUBS2030) was launched in 2020 to strengthen biodiversity conservation and restoration. The EUBS2030 aims to establish a coherent network of protected areas and highlights that the existing network of protected areas is not sufficiently large...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Internal project communication flow
result.description: Report outlining the flow of how the internal project communication is going to be run to ensure internal adherence to the key deadlines and quality standards. Linked with Task 7.4.

result.title: Strategy for Addressing the Ethics and Intellectual Property Rights in the Project
result.description: A report outlining the strategy for addressing the Ethics and Intellectual Property Rights in the Project will be developed. Linked with Task 7.5.

result.title: BLUE4ALL project governance structure
result.description: The project governance structure will describe sound legal, contractual, financial and administrative management practices of the project, in compliance with the contractual obligations, good management practices and the provisions of the Consortium Agreement and release of end reports. Linked with Task 7.1.

result.title: Dissemination and communication plan, and visual identity
result.description: This is a strategic document establishing individual partner responsibilities and timelines, guidelines and suggestions, target groups, most appropriate channels and branding of the project among others. Linked with Task 6.1

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: A report outlining among other, clear data management responsibilities to make the project outputs FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable), following guidelines from the EU. The plan includes the definition of the data and publication policy and the GDPR. Linked with Task 7.5.

result.title: Establishment of Stakeholder Engagement Groups
result.description: Stakeholder Engagement Groups (SEGs) declaration of establishment by the Institutions in charge of MPA or MPA Network – one per Living Lab. - Linked with task 4.2

result.title: First update of the strategy for Addressing the Ethics and Intellectual Property Rights in the Project
result.description: The report outlining the strategy for addressing the Ethics and Intellectual Property Rights in the Project will be updated for a first time. Linked with Task 7.5.

result.title: 1.2 - Report on the available frameworks and tools for building constituency and expectations management
result.description: This report wlll assess methods, processes and best practical guidance and recommendations for transboundary consultations, public participation and co-creation processes. - Linked with Task 1.2

result.title: Information sites engagement plan
result.description: A strategic document to guide and inform intelligence gathering from information sites, setting scene and establishing rules of engagement with information providers (MPA practitioners and stakeholders).- Linked with Task 4.1

result.title: Report on the review of socio-ecological framework and methodologies
result.description: This report will summarize the knowledge basis of socio-ecological frameworks and methodologies related to the effective governance of MPA/OECMs. - Linked to Task 1.3

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
